show.subtitle: Your Economic Survival?  They're Not Looking Out For You.  We are.
show.title: The Wake Up Call

header.title: The Special Place Of Housing In The American Psyche

title: The Special Place Of Housing In The American Psyche
content:
Housing represents 17-18% of GDP, not including what goes into it. <!--more--> Nothing the Fed has done has alleviated the appalling situation that obtained after the bubble that ended in 2005.
Sales of existing homes have fallen or the last seven months.
Builders are in trouble because they have created a glut of new homes for sale.
Record affordability still has not attracted people into them.
GDP at 0.
1% growth is not indicative of a recovery!
International trade has collapsed.
All that is certain is that nothing is going to help the recovery recover.
Real estate is built to very different norms in Latin America.
A word about Richard Fisher, the Federal Reserve’s rebel.
Lawrence Wilkerson, high-ranking whistleblower of the government.
Yellen’s self-imposed ‘inflation target’.
The US Post Office: more losses.
